quotes: They provided substantial first-hand evidence to support the development and ratification of the UN campaigns for sanctions against Southern Rhodesia in 1975 and South Africa in 1977 (UN Security Council Resolution 418).

They provided substantial first-hand evidence to support the development and ratification of the UN campaigns for sanctions against Southern Rhodesia in 1975 and South Africa in 1977 (UN Security Council Resolution 418).
In the inaugural edition of Decolonization, published by the UN in June 1974, Salim wrote about the information asymmetry that confronted the liberation movements:
This crucial media campaign, motivated by UNGA Resolution 2879 of 1971, was also informed by Salim’s consultations, in his capacity as chair of the committee, with international NGOs,

The recommendations of the 1972 Mission Report to the liberated territories of Guinea-Bissau suggested that first-hand information should be used to place more diplomatic pressure on the government of Portugal.
